citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Opal, a female fawn Boston Terrier, DOB 4/10/22, microchip# 99100300064914 had a moderate accumulation of brown
material on the surface of the cheek teeth. The licensee stated he used oral preventative care but the dog has not had
any professional teeth cleaning. It is important to ensure all animals have no signs of dental disease.
The abnormal build-up of material on the teeth can cause damage to the gum tissue and tooth structures. This condition
could be painful, may decrease the dog's ability to eat normally, and may result in spread of bacteria to other parts of the
body such as liver and kidneys which can negatively impact the overall health of the animal.
The licensee must communicate with the attending veterinarian to evaluate the dog and determine an appropriate plan for
diagnosis and treatment.
Correct by: 2/20/25

There were four dogs approximately 1.5 years old that had not been vaccinated for rabies. The Program of Veterinary
Care on file lists rabies vaccines to be performed at 16 weeks of age.
Failure to vaccinate dogs for rabies according to the program of veterinary care may result in lack of protection from this
serious disease.
Vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases of dogs, including rabies, must be performed in accordance with a
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian.
Correct by: 2/20/25
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Alexandra Calderon, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Opal, a female fawn Boston Terrier, DOB 4/10/22, microchip# 99100300064914 had a moderate accumulation of brown 
material on the surface of the cheek teeth. The licensee stated he used oral preventative care but the dog has not had 
any professional teeth cleaning. It is important to ensure all animals have no signs of dental disease.  
The abnormal build-up of material on the teeth can cause damage to the gum tissue and tooth structures. This condition 
could be painful, may decrease the dog's ability to eat normally, and may result in spread of bacteria to other parts of the 
body such as liver and kidneys which can negatively impact the overall health of the animal. 
The licensee must communicate with the attending veterinarian to evaluate the dog and determine an appropriate plan for 
diagnosis and treatment. 
Correct by: 2/20/25 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
There were four dogs approximately 1.5 years old that had not been vaccinated for rabies. The Program of Veterinary 
Care on file lists rabies vaccines to be performed at 16 weeks of age. 
Failure to vaccinate dogs for rabies according to the program of veterinary care may result in lack of protection from this 
serious disease. 
Vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases of dogs, including rabies, must be performed in accordance with a 
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian. 
Correct by: 2/20/25 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Alexandra Calderon, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
